mainPage.paragraph: Powerful and environmentally friendly – that’s LEM SSV. For the first time, the LEM Wrocław team has developed a four-wheel off-road vehicle that represents a vision for the future of the zero-emission Dakar Rally. A creative process with a zero-waste rule and an end result that generates a powerful dose of emotion. Can it be better?

He conquered the Spanish MotorLand Aragón and already took a podium finish on the F1 circuit in Italy. However, it is possible that the prototype of the students reaches up to 200 km/h. Get to know the innovative LEM Photon project – the first Polish electric road motorcycle built entirely by students of the Wrocław University of Science and Technology.

paragraphs.pText: We are a group of 50 students working as a research group for vehicles and mobile robots. We form the Light Electric Motorcycle (LEM Wrocław) project under the auspices of the Wrocław University of Science and Technology. We design and build electric motorcycles from the ground up, but this year we decided to create something completely new, namely an electric off-road vehicle type Buggy (Project LEM SSV).

Our team focuses mainly on preparing for international electric motorcycle competitions. You can meet us at fairs and motorcycle events. We develop dynamically by participating in other competitions both locally and abroad. We are also charitable.

This year we developed a racing motorcycle (LEM Photon) that we took to a MotoStudent competition (the most prestigious motorcycle competition in the world, the MotoGP equivalent). Thanks to the work of the whole team, we won 1st place in the Best Rookie Team category.

bosses.name: Michał Skraburski
bosses.description: He has many years of experience in several departments and has the ability to lead a team. He is a representative of our organisation both in the university and in dealing with companies that support student activities. Through the scientific community takes care of its development by the organization participating in international competitions. Its duties include supervising the work of the heads of the various departments and supervising all projects.

bosses.name: Piotr Wyszyński
bosses.description: The Electrical Department deals with the assembly of electric drives, which are built from the ground up in our garage. We design and manufacture a battery of certain dimensions, connect it to the ECU and the motor, and then design the characteristics of the drive by changing the ECU settings. In addition, we deal with the creation of the entire electric beam, where our task includes the output of the voltage 12V required for the operation of the ECU, the programming of the display and the connection of the joystick or the control buttons.

bosses.name: Wiktoria Budziar
bosses.description: The marketing department is not just social media. Our department monitors during contests and competitions and takes care of the image of the entire team. We are where all motorcycle fairs and events of all kinds are. We take care of the contact with the authorities of the Wrocław University of Science and Technology as well as with external companies that support our activities.

bosses.name: Nikodem Kruk
bosses.description: The chassis department focuses on the design, construction and regulation of the chassis. The planning phase usually starts with our team. We decide which shock absorber and forks we use, what before analyzing the kinematics of the motorcycle, where we give it all the characteristic points and decide what character it will have.

bosses.name: Michał Lentner
bosses.description: The design department specialises in all supporting structures, housings and fastenings. Our task is to design the components in such a way that the safety of both the driver and the sensitive interior components is maximized. In addition to design and modeling, we manufacture our own parts by preparing, welding or bending.

bosses.name: Igor Radoch
bosses.description: The Department of Mechanics deals with the planning and execution of the drive system, the engine cooling system, and the ergonomics of the driver. We carry out both workshop work and preparation work for tests or races. Our aim is to achieve the best possible performance on the track with every further project.

lastParagraph.pText: The lines of the LEM Wrocław project are supported by a talented and young rider, Krzysztof Borys. Thanks to him, the team was able to start the LEM Photon project, drawing on his knowledge and experience. Better known under the pseudonym Little Kris, his adventure with motorcycles began at the age of 5. It quickly developed into a passion and soon into a working life for Kris. He founded the family brand MotoKenner and offers motorcycle training on his race track.

projects.paragraph: The LEM Photon is the first electric road bike in Poland to be built entirely by students of the Wrocław University of Science and Technology. The prototype was developed to participate in the international MotoStudent Competition 2021, the MotoGP equivalent for students. LEM Photon proved to be the pride of the LEM Wrocław project and helped the team win the title of the Student Research Group of the Year 2021. The motorcycle has already visited many circuits in Poland, including the Poznań Circuit and the Krzywa Circuit. In Spain at the Motorland Aragón and in Italy at the Autodromo Enzo e Dino Ferrari, where he made large deposits.

LEM Thunder v2 is an optimization of the previous project, i. e. the prototype of an electric cross motorcycle. It is a motorcycle made by students of the Technical University of Wroclaw themselves. It was dedicated to people who want to feel the emotions of rallies and off-road rides. He participated in several international competitions of the Smart Moto Challenge, where he achieved high marks in many categories. The LEM Thunder v2 project is also a proposal for state institutions such as the Border Guard, which guards the borders in the forest and mountainous regions, and the National Park Guard, which manages large forest areas where engines are not allowed. The LEM Wrocław project is also suitable for paved roads – it only needs to change the tyres, which classifies it for use under all conditions.

Due to its four-wheeled character, the LEM SSV is a pioneer project in the ranks of the LEM Wrocław team. It requires using the zero-waste principles and giving the components used a second life in an innovative zero-emission design. The LEM SSV is a side-by-side electric off-road vehicle based on a Polaris frame. Equipped with a 4x4 drivetrain that can be switched to 2x4, the LEM SSV is able to master the challenges both off-road and on the road.

LRP.paragraphs: MotoStudent International Competition was a big step forward  when it came to the development of our student research group. We built off-road motorcycles so far, but we decided to participate in a challenge between Universities Students' teams from all over the world. We had to relearn how to build sports motorcycles, which are different in almost every way from what we know thus far. After two years of hard work, we built the first Polish electric motorcycle, which took the 6th place in the competition and won the title of the best rookie team.

This success was noticed by the Polish motorcycle community. Marcin “Kosa' Kolanowski, the manager of the LRP Poland team*, turned to us and on November 2021, he came to see LEM`s garage, told us about the team and invited us to LRP garage in Warsaw. (*LRP Poland – Polish Team participating in the International Motorcycling Federation Endurance World Championship).

On our first trip to the capital, Kosa showed us motorcycles, introduced to the team, taught us how to make a pit stop and told what usually happens during the race. Bartłomiej Lewandowski and Marcin Kolanowski wanted to rejuvenate the team and train new generation of mechanics. On the next 2-day excursion, we were practicing a lot, from pit stops to testing suspension system. At the end of our visit, Marcin selected some people to take them to Spain for a motorcycle Pre-Tests. We got to know the team and the drivers. It was a huge test of our abilities and how we deal with the stress. I think we passed, because Kosa invited us to Pre-tests at Le Mans.

That was amazing - he chose us – the members of the LEM Wrocław – from many others Polish universities, he has visited. Legendary Circuit 24 Hours of Le Mans is remarkable and you can feel the atmosphere of race everywhere. In my opinion, a part of your soul stays there forever. It was a really challenging journey, we learned a lot and were ready for more. Finally, it was time for the long-awaited race – the 24 Hours of Le Mans - the first round of FIM EWC. A week of preparation, testing, qualifying, sleepless nights, to make the motorcycle ready for the race. People singing the Marseillaise, the growling engines, the tears of happiness and excitement, it is impossible to describe that wonderful feeling of being part of such an event.

3:00 p.m. Green flag. The first 6 hours passed in 6 minutes, the worst time for mechanics came in the morning, but we did it, we did it! 23 feet, 801 laps! Our riders – Bartłomiej Lewandowski, Dominik Vincon and Stefan Kerschbaumer – were incredible! 6th in the EWC and 14th in the overall classification! In May we were on pre-tests in Belgium, a very tough track in Spa, but we managed to prepare our BMW S1000RR for the second round of the World Championship. Spa-Francorchamps - circuit considered as a one of the most demanding circuit.

We had a week to get to know him well. This time already calmer, we gave 1000%! After a serious accident in qualifying, Bartłomiej Lewandowski completed 40 laps during the race. The remaining 450 were divided between Dominik Vincon and Pepijn Bijsterbosch. The race was unpredictable, sun, rain, 2-hours break in the competition on Sunday morning, when one of the motorcycles spilled out the oil across the wet road.

Despite all obstacles, the riders of Team LRP Poland finished the competition in 10th place overall and 9th in the EWC class! Without LEM Wrocław we would not be a part of the LRP Poland Team. Thanks to the knowledge we have gathered in the student research group and our passion, we had the opportunity to made our dreams to come true and acquired the knowledge we can use building new projects.
